featured.text: And in 1994, Microsoft CEO (chief executive officer) Bill Gates paid $30.8 million for a handwritten notebook penned by Leonardo da Vinci.
Showing great talent in painting, Moran was soon hired as an illustrator at Scribner’s Monthly, and later appointed chief illustrator by age 34.
Seeing this, Brahma, the chief god, decided to take their divinity away from them and hide it 22 it could never be found.

other.text: Inside the homes of high-ranking chiefs is where house poles were found.
The company is _____ and making great profits under the wise leadership of the chief executive officer.
Traditionally, shame poles were carved for a chief to embarrass and ridicule another who had done something wrong.
They were erected in memory of a deceased chief or a high-ranking clan member.

definition.en_def: The leader or head of a group; most important.
definition.example: The chief of the tribe made an important announcement.
